text: The hydrolysis of proteins by diluting mineral acids produces
Which of the following oxide causes acid rain?
explanation:
Acid rain results when sulfur dioxide (SO2) and nitrogen oxides (NOX) are emitted into the atmosphere and transported by wind and air currents.
The SO2 and NOX react with water, oxygen and other chemicals to form sulfuric and nitric acids.

text: The ratio of carbon atoms of hydrogen atoms in a hydrocarbon is 1:2. If its molecular mass is 56, what is its molecular formula?

What is the relative molecular mass of the compound below?
 

 
[H = 1.0; C = 12.0; O = 16.0]
explanation:
The molecular formula of the compound in question is \(C_6H_5COOCH_3\)
Then its relative molecular mass = 8C + 8H + 2O = 8 X 12 + 8 x 1 + 2 X 16 = 136

text: Cathodic protection of metals is based on
If humid air is polluted by chlorine discharged, the air can be restored by sprinkling
explanation: Chlorine is a toxic gas and when it pollutes the air, it can be neutralized by using acidified KMnO4. The reaction between chlorine and acidified KMnO4 results in the formation of chloride ions, manganese(II) ions, and water, which are harmless. This is why acidified KMnO4 is used to restore air polluted by chlorine discharge.

explanation: It is primary alcohol because it has only one alkyl group and dihydric because it has two hydroxyl groups

text: Which of the following pairs of compounds would form a precipitate when their aqueous solutions are mixed?
explanation:
when potassium sulfate is mixed with barium chloride a white precipitate of barium sulfate will be form. barium sulfate is slightly soluble in water, so it will precipitate out as a solid
BaCl2 + K2SO4 → BaSO4 + 2KCl
note; all substances are aqueous except BaSO4 which is solid

explanation: Hygroscopic substances are used to keep products dry or to remove water from an area. They are commonly used in desiccatorsSome common examples of hygroscopic substances include: Sodium chloride. Zinc chloride. Calcium chloride

text: What would be observed when aqueous ammonia is added in drops and then in excess to a solution of copper(II) ions?

options.A: blue precipitate is formed which is soluble in excess ammonia
options.B: brick red precipitate is produced which is insoluble in excess ammonia
options.C: white precipitate is formed which is excess in ammonia
options.D: green precipitate is formed which is insoluble in excess ammonia

explanation: Whena few drops of ammonia solutionis added to copper(II) ions,a blue precipitateof copper(II) hydroxide is formed.CuSO₄(aq) + 2NH₃(aq) + 2H₂O(ℓ) ⇌ Cu(OH)₂(s) + (NH₄)₂SO₄(aq)However, whenammonia solutionis addedin excess, the blue precipitate re-dissolves to forma deep blue solutionof tetraamine copper(II) hydroxide.Cu(OH)₂(s) + 4NH₃(aq) → [Cu(NH₃)₄](OH)₂(aq). Therefore, the correct answer is optionA.

options.A: there would be no visible change
options.B: a blue precipitate would be formed
options.C: the resulting solution would become colourless
options.D: a white precipitate would be formed

[Ag = 108.0; 1F = 96500 C]
The Bohr model of the atom proposed the existence of?
explanation: Bohr Model is a planetary model in which the negatively charged electrons orbit a small, positively charged nucleus similar to the planets .

text: The 25°C evaporation of a 100 cm\(^{3}\) solution of K\(_{2}\)CO\(_{3}\) to dryness gave 14g of the salt. What is the solubility of K\(_{2}\)CO\(_{3}\) at 25°C? [K\(_{2}\)CO\(_{3}\) = 138]
explanation:
solubility( in mol/dm^3) = \(\frac{ mass  of salt}{ Molar Mass of salt} = \frac{ 1000cm^3}{ volume of solution in cm^3}\)
\(\frac{14}{138 } = \frac{ 1000cm^3}{ 100}\)
\(\frac{14000}{13800}  = 1.01 mol/dm^3\)

options.B: the titer values obtained from the titration are equal

text: Which of the following statements about elements in Group VII is correct?

options.B: F\(_{2}\) has the least tendency to be reduced
options.D: l\(_{2}\) is a stronger oxidizing agent than F\(_{2}\)

explanation: Cl\(_2\) can oxidize I\(^-\). Chlorine (Cl\(_2\)) is a stronger oxidizing agent than iodine (I\(_2\)), meaning it can take electrons from other substances more readily. In a reaction between Cl\(_2\) and I-, the Cl\(_2\) will gain electrons from I\(_2\) oxidizing I- to I\(^-\).and reducing Cl\(_2\)to Cl\(^-\).

text: Electrovalent compounds normally ------------

options.C: conduct electricity in the solid state

text: A coordinate covalent bond could be formed between?
explanation: A coordinate covalent bond, also known as a dative bond, dipolar bond, or coordinate bond is a kind of two-center, two-electron covalent bond in which the two electrons derive from the same atom.
